remarks: A ring is a domain iff all nonzero elements are non-zero-divisors. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Mar-2015.)
statement:
isdomn2.b $e |- B = ( Base ` R ) $.
isdomn2.t $e |- E = ( RLReg ` R ) $.
isdomn2.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` R ) $.
isdomn2 $p |- ( R e. Domn <-> ( R e. NzRing /\ ( B \ { .0. } ) C_ E ) ) $.
